alert.note: Alert for San Diego County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 25 at 9:18PM PST until December 26 at 10:00AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST SUNDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Snow and strong southwest to west winds expected. Total accumulations of 2 to 5 inches are expected above 5300 feet late tonight and early Sunday. Additional accumulations of 4 to 8 inches are possible late Monday and Monday night, with snow levels falling to between 3500 and 4000 feet. * WHERE...San Diego County Mountains. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, through 10 AM Sunday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from 2 PM Monday afternoon through 3 AM Tuesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Southwest winds of 20 to 40 mph, with gusts 50 to locally 60 mph. Be prepared for significant reductions in visibility at times in snow, blowing snow and fog. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Weather Advisory for blowing snow means that visibilities will be limited due to strong winds blowing snow around. Use caution when traveling, especially in open areas. For road condition information in California...enter 8 0 0 4 2 7 7 6 2 3 if inside california or 9 1 6 4 5 5 7 6 2 3 if outside California. A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow, sleet or ice accumulations that may impact travel. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts.
